name: The Ritz-Carlton, Atlanta

reviews.text: You shouldn't have to buy a suite to get a good size room. I figured club level would get me a decent room but this room is something I'd pay $175 per night! My bathroom barely fit me and I'm 5'1, 115 lbs! Much less my Hubby and I! Great service though, excellent restaurant and bar. Address not listed correctly for GPS but that's a whole other story...
reviews.title: Don't expect a spacious room on club level
Wifi
reviews.text: Considering the cost of a room in this place, charging an extra $12.95 a day for wifi really grates.
Other than that the hotel is rather nice and the bar is lively. Best hotel I've stayed at in Downtown.
reviews.title: Excellent location and service

reviews.text: Got it at a great rate by booking months in advance. The Ritz knows how to do service. Every staff member I interacted was friendly and professional and very attentive. A great hotel. Turn down service, keeping track of my preference for the New York Times; having my car ready in the morning. Wow. I could get used to this.
reviews.title: Elegant room, attentive service - loved everything except the room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent fitness facilities; nice rooms. Grand piano with classical music in the side lobby; live music in the bar - great place to stay. Hard to leave.
reviews.title: Beautiful room and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quietest room I have ever stayed in... Great bed and shower. Gave it 4 out of 5 as the entrance on arrival was chaos! Insane entry.... Chos of cars. Only thing hat could be better. Front desk was efficient and concierge. Quick bag delivery to the room.
reviews.title: Quiet.... Sshhhhh!

reviews.text: I was here for work and I am not one to EVER pay for a luxurious hotel (so you would expect that I would be blown away by a hotel with such a fantastic reputation right?) First off the service and the "ladies and gentlemen" of the Ritz are incredible - sweet, respectful and very eager to help. The room itself was kind of bland. It was extremely clean but the walls and decor of the rooms were somewhat mediocre. I wasn't impressed at all. They could have lush bedding or just a different color scheme. There were two paintings on one side of the wall (they were very small) just seemed half completed. Although they truely know how to treat their patrons - it was amazing!
reviews.title: In the laps of luxury

reviews.text: Just had my second stay here and do agree that in general the property is attractive and thestaff is good. The rooms are nice and they provide HD TV. I found the beds very soft and that is uncomfortable to me. Restaurant on site was OK for breakfast and sub par for dinner.
reviews.title: Downtown Atlanta in comfort

reviews.text: We did have a rather vexing time with the "free car service." The person who handled this was clearly out of her depth and should not have been interacting with customers. We inquired about Buckhead and were informed that the service did not go that far. With a different inquiry we were told the car was busy handling a ride to the airport. So, Buckhead no but airport yes? This was really irritating and it happened twice. It was pretty clear that this "guest service" just was not available.
reviews.title: This is a Ritz Carlton?

reviews.text: We were in town on business so this was a great location for walking. This hotel is good. But, Ritz Carlton is supposed to be great, right?
reviews.title: what a way to go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I attended a busienss meeting recently and stayed at this hotel as a result. From the moment I checked in to check out problems occured which did not reflect the high standard the Ritz Carlton promises its guests. As a Marriott Platnum Guest I arrived at 3:15 PM for check in which at this property 3 PM is the appointed check in time to find my room was not ready. The front desk then tried to assign me another room keeping me at the front desk area for over 35 mintues! In addition to the time they asked me countless questions regarding my preferences etc which are all included in my Marriott Profile and reservation. The result was a standard room assignment on the 8th floor, keep in mind my preferences are a high floor, upgrade along with other requests but none delivered. The front desk staff recongnized my displeasure and sent a cheese plate up which was a nice touch, however this process was unacceptable. The room was standard and the housekeeping service spotty at best with no replenishment of items such as shampoo, conditioner, soap etc. Also on one of the days upon my return I found my room door with the dead bolt engaged and door open !! This security violation is totally unacceptable, and glad to report I had no items missing. I have complained to Marriott and would not recommend this property you can do much better at one of the other hotels such as the Westin Peachtree across the street! The hotel rooms need updating big time and the staff needs a course in customer relations. Major dissppointment that I won't repeat anytime soon!
reviews.title: Friendly staff!

reviews.text: Yes, this hotel is a bit expensive but oh,oh so worth it! From check in to room and special ammenities, to answered questions, to hailing a cab or giving you a quick local ride, even providing me with a wheel chair to use! If you go the extra mile with the Club - it is a wonderful deal! An all around wonderful experience.
reviews.title: impeccable service

description: The Ritz-Carlton, Atlanta is downtown's premier business address and a luxurious oasis in the heart of the city. Awe-inspiring interiors create an unequaled environment for work and play. Surrounded by the state's centers of finance and government, and just minutes from the Georgia Aquarium and sports events at the Georgia Dome, Philips Arena and Turner Field, The Ritz-Carlton, Atlanta is ideally situated.
